isis.stitle: DT/DTI-466 A and B Series DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS - CREATIVE TOOL MODEL CT-400 DIESEL TIMING AND TACHOMETER INSTRUMENT [SE-2783] OR [3005] EARLIER MODEL - OPERATING INSTRUCTIONS

step1.para: Clean the area of the injection pump where the transducer is to be installed.The transducer must be installed on the #1 or #6 cylinder fuel outlet at the pump for UTDS Model 100 Pumps or Robert Bosch "MW" and "A" Model Fuel Injection Pumps. Do NOT install at the nozzle end of the fuel pipe.
Install the 14 mm Split-Nut Transducer as follows: [UTDS Model 100 Pumps only]

step2.para:
Remove the fuel line connector nut (1 Figure 4.8)
and slide it up the pipe. Secure the displaced nut with tape to prevent bouncing of the nut and possible erratic readings.

Install the 14 mm Split-Nut Transducer (2, Figure 4.8)
over the fuel line by slipping the slotted portion of the transducer on the line and tighten the Split-Nut Transducer to all slight fuel leakage at the split-nut when the engine is started. Tighten the split-nut only until leakage stops. Use of this method will allow you to achieve the required torque of 15-20 lbf-ft. (20-27 N.m).

important.para: Loosen the fuel injection line nut at the pump while holding the delivery valve holder with a modified 7/8 in. 12 pt. box wrench to prevent delivery valve movement (which could affect rack travel). The 7/8 in. wrench used to hold the delivery valve must be modified by cutting a slot which allows it to pass over the fuel line. Refer to (CGES-415-*) Section 11 for procedures.

step2.para: Connect the (SE-2783) or (3005) to the short coaxial (white) cable of the transducer using the BNC (bayonet) connector.

step1.para: Mark the "TDC" dot on the crankshaft pulley and the front cover pointer with white paint or similar product for ease of viewing.

Connect the power leads to any 12 or 24 volt negative ground electrical system. The power leads are color coded. Connect red clip lead to the plus (+) side of the battery and the black clip lead to a good ground. Connect the plug end of the cable to the threaded plug on the panel. Connect the transducer cord to the push-turn plug on the panel.

note.para: Before proceeding with a running check, it is recommended that an injection pump static (engine stopped) timing check be made.

important.para: ONLY THE TACHOMETER FUNCTION Of THE TOOL (SE-2783) IS USED TO DIAGNOSE DT/DTI/DTA-466 C DIESEL ENGINES. DYNAMIC TIMING IS NOT MEASURED.

step1.para: Start the engine and check for fuel leaks.
Perform the speed and timing checks as follows: (See OPERATION, this section).

step2.para: Turn power on by moving the "TACH.OFF-T. LIGHT" to the "TACH." postion. Red power supply light will be on.
Check calibration as described in OPERATION, this section.
Put "TACH.-ADVANCE"switch to "TACH." position. Measure and adjust engine speed to indicate the appropriate engine RPM as shown in PERFORMANCE DATA GUIDELINES, Sections 5 and 6.

Put the "TACH.-OFF-T. LIGHT" switch to the "T. LIGHT" position. Move the "TACH.-ADVANCE" switch to the "ADVANCE" position. Rotate "ADVANCE" knob as directed in OPERATION, this section, to obtain timing.

Switch the "TACH.-OFF-T. LIGHT" and "TACH.-ADVANCE" to the "TACH." positions. Adjust engine speed to specified total pump timing speed for the particular application (see PERFORMANCE DATA GUIDELINES), sections 5 and 6.)

Move the "TACH.-OFF-T. LIGHT" and "TACH.-ADVANCE" switch to "T. LIGHT" AND "ADVANCE"respectively. Rotate "ADVANCE" knob as directed in OPERATION, this section, to obtain injection pump timing (Degrees of Advance). Compare readings with specifications.

important.para: IF THERE IS A QUESTION OF TIMING LIGHT ACCURACY, FLOW TIME THE PUMP AS DESCRIBED IN SECTION 5. FLOW TIMING IS ACCOMPLISHED WITHOUT REMOVING THE PUMP DELIVERY VALVE.
